How did AlphaFold-Multimer assist in sta: AlphaFold-Multimer predictions assisted in designing mutations to stabilize the FV Env in its pre-fusion state.
AlphaFold-Multimer directly modified the FV Env protein to stabilize its pre-fusion state.
AlphaFold-Multimer synthesized chemical stabilizers for the FV Env protein's pre-fusion state.
AlphaFold-Multimer predicted the degradation pathways of the FV Env protein to prevent its fusion state.
How did AlphaFold-Multimer contribute to: AlphaFold-Multimer predicted the full-length structure of the FV Env trimer, providing insights into regions not resolved in experimental structures.
AlphaFold-Multimer determined the sequence of the FV Env trimer, offering insights into its genetic variability.
AlphaFold-Multimer identified the binding partners of the FV Env trimer, revealing its interaction network.
AlphaFold-Multimer calculated the thermodynamic stability of the FV Env trimer, predicting its folding efficiency.
What evolutionary insight was gained fro: The structural conservation between FV Env and paramyxo- and pneumovirus F proteins suggests potential cross-reactive epitopes.
The structural analysis revealed that FV Env proteins are unique to foamy viruses with no evolutionary links.
The structural analysis indicated that FV Env proteins are more closely related to bacterial proteins.
The structural analysis showed that FV Env proteins have evolved independently from other viral proteins.
What role does AlphaFold-Multimer play i: AlphaFold-Multimer provides structural insights that guide the identification of conserved regions and potential binding sites for nanobodies.
AlphaFold-Multimer sequences the genetic material of SARS-CoV-2 to identify nanobody targets.
AlphaFold-Multimer simulates the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 to predict nanobody efficacy.
AlphaFold-Multimer generates chemical compounds that can be used as nanobodies against SARS-CoV-2.
What structural similarity did the paper: The Foamy Virus envelope glycoprotein is structurally similar to the fusion proteins of paramyxo- and pneumoviruses.
The Foamy Virus envelope glycoprotein is structurally similar to the capsid proteins of retroviruses.
The Foamy Virus envelope glycoprotein is structurally similar to the polymerase proteins of influenza viruses.
The Foamy Virus envelope glycoprotein is structurally similar to the envelope proteins of flaviviruses.
